to sign one's name; visa; variant of 签
поставить свою подпись; виза; вариант 签

签签		sign, endorse, slip of paper

purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 签)
Pictophonetic: 僉 indicates the sound; ⺮ (bamboo) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
簽訂 [ qiān dìng ]: to agree to and sign (a treaty etc)
簽署 [ qiān shǔ ]: to sign (an agreement)
簽字 [ qiān zì ]: to sign (one's name); signature
簽名 [ qiān míng ]: to sign (one's name with a pen etc); to autograph; signature
簽約 [ qiān yuē ]: to sign a contract or agreement

    • 僉 [ qiān ] all, together, unanimous
heisig_chinese_memo: After a bamboo price debate the construction companies sign a deal.
Ru_trainchinese: qiān: (глаг/сущ) расписываться, подписывать; давать краткий комментарий; бамбуковые бирки для гадания; заостренная палочка из дерева или бамбука; ярлык, бирка
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: I put big stalks of bamboo at my front door as a sign that I'm having my Chinese New Year hootenanny.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " bamboo " and "佥", the original meaning is the signature or the inscription on the document or bill for identification. "Pianhai Series·Flowers and Trees·Bamboo Department": "Sign, sign the text of the book." Song Su Shi's "Begging to Stop the Detailed Service Law": "The minister is different, it is difficult to sign the book with the crowd."

" Signing " can mean extracting the main points or drafting a short opinion. Song Sima Guang, "The Prelude to the Begging of the Subjects": "It is the prelude to the begging of the ministers. The three provinces will be paid. The commissioner will collect it for details. Choose whichever is available and sign out with yellow paper.

" Sign " can also be expressed sign cards, the ancient government office that is often used as evidence to arrest prisoners, the use of bamboo. "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 4: "(Jia Yucun) issued a signature and the servant immediately took the culprit’s family to torture. I saw a door standing beside the case, so that he won’t be asked to issue a signature."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " bamboo " and "佥", the original meaning is the signature or inscription on the documents and receipts for identification.
humanum_full_description:
從「竹」，「僉」聲，本義為文件、單據上署名或題寫文字以為標識。《篇海類編‧花木類‧竹部》：「簽，簽書文字也。」宋蘇軾〈乞罷詳定役法劄子〉：「臣既不同，決難隨眾簽書。」

　　「簽」可表示摘出要點或擬寫簡短意見。宋司馬光〈乞降臣民奏狀劄子〉：「即乞依臣前奏，降付三省，委執政官分取看詳，擇其可取者用黃紙簽出。」

　　「簽」也可表示簽牌，即古代官衙中常用作拘捕犯人的憑證，多用竹製。《紅樓夢》第4回：「（賈雨村）便發簽差公人立刻將凶犯家屬拿來拷問。只見案旁站着一個門子，使眼色不叫他發簽。」
humanum_short_description: 從「竹」，「僉」聲，本義為文件、單據上署名或題寫文字以為標識。

(Simplified: 签)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 僉 indicates the sound; ⺮ (bamboo) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • ⺮ [ zhú ] bamboo; flute
    • 僉 [ qiān ] all, together, unanimous
①親自寫姓名或畫上符號：簽名。簽字。簽到。簽發。簽收。簽署。簽押。簽訂。
②簡要地寫出意見：簽註。簽呈。簽證。
③用竹木等物做成的細棍或片狀物：牙籤兒。
④書冊裏作標誌的紙片或其他物體上作標誌的東西：書籤。標籤。
⑤粗粗地縫合起來。
⑥用於占卜或賭博的細長竹片或細棍：籤筒。求籤。

Song Su Shi's "Begging to Stop the Detailed Service Law": "The minister is different, it is difficult to sign the book with the crowd." " Signing" can mean extracting the main points or drafting a short opinion. Song Sima Guang, "The Prelude to the Begging of the Subjects": "It is the prelude to the begging of the ministers. The three provinces will be paid. The commissioner will collect it for details. Choose whichever is available and sign out with yellow paper. 簽字的基本解释

簽
qiān
见“签”。

簽字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qiān］
［《集韻》千廉切，平鹽，清。］
“签1”的繁体字。
(1)摘出要点或拟写简短意见。
(2)今亦指签字，签名。
(3)签牌。旧时官衙中常用作拘捕犯人的凭证。多竹制。
(4)下令征调。
(5)刺；插。
(6)引申指讥刺。
(7)引，导引。
(8)指炸煎食品。
(9)签子。一种用竹木或铁丝制成的尖细棍子。亦用作量词，犹串。

簽字的康熙字典解释

【未集上】【竹字部】　簽； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页902第02
【集韻】千廉切，音籖。【博雅】簽、籯，籠也。　又【篇海】簽書文字也。

簽字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
簽字的起名意思

暂无。

sign
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qiān］
["Ji Yun" Qianlian cut, flat salt, clear. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "signed 1".
(1) Summarize the main points or prepare a short opinion.
(2) Today also refers to signature and signature.
(3) Signing. In the old days, officials were often used as evidence for arresting prisoners. More bamboo.
(4) Order the levy.
(5) Thorns; inserts.
(6) The extension refers to ridicule.
(7) Lead, lead.
(8) Refers to fried food.
(9) Signs. A thin stick made of bamboo or iron wire. Also used as a quantifier, still string.
sign
